page.title: 09Housing in Colden Common
page.content: The western boundary of the block cuts through the village leaving the greater part to the west.This western part consists mainly of modern(post 1960s)estates of private housing with some Local Authority development. To the east of the boundary the settlement has developed along the Winchester-Portsmouth road.Here are found some of the older houses in the village,although most are of post 1900 age.A somewhat incongruous feature is the presence of two mobile-home parks adjacent to the main road.Both have been laid out in disused sand-and clay-pits. In the south the small hamlet of Fishers Pond extends along Hensting Lane.Here the dwellings are in rather more spacious grounds,some backing on to the lake.
